intro: Herpestis connata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes true nettles, and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender, hairy stalks. Its stems are covered in fine hairs and often have a reddish tinge, especially near the nodes. Herpestis connata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
